subject: Making a large set of tests as efficient as possible
msgSnippet: Hi there! Just a quick question. I have  a suite that lines up about 25 test classes ( each containing say 10 test methods ) and I iterate for 300 objects to
messageBody:
Hi there!

Just a quick question. I have a suite that lines up about 25 test
classes ( each containing say 10 test methods ) and I iterate for 300
objects to add these tests to a suite. I would like to know any best
practices to ensure I don't get any OutOfMemoryErrors. I changed the
jvm tag to increase virtual memory to say 512 but, if I keep adding
many tests to this suite, what would be the next item to ensure I'm
doing. I am also setting TestCase member variables to null where
possible. What would be the next step? The reason I ask is because I
would like to push JUnit to the limit and have it test all day and
night for a large application. Any help or comments would be
appreciated. Even different design techniques are welcome.

Cheers!
Claudio
